Package ui

Class PlayScreen

java.lang.Object
ui.UI
ui.PlayScreen
public class PlayScreen extends UI
Used to draw the user interface during gameplay onto the screen. Contains methods to update different elements of the UI.
Author:
Jeffrey Jin (jjj9), Seughwan Kim

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayScreen

      protected PlayScreen(GamePanel gp)
      Calls the UI constructor. Loads heart sprites into the player health array.
      Parameters:
      gp - GamePanel object that is used to run the game

  • Method Details

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String text)
      Displays a message on the screen.
      Parameters:
      text - the message that is to be displayed

    • resetTimer

      public void resetTimer()
      Reset the timer to zero.

    • resetMessage

      public void resetMessage()
      Turns off messages and deletes the saved messsage.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the game UI while the user is playing the game. Shows current health, level name, score and time. Messages may appear on the screen to indicate to the player what is happening such as when a player interacts with an object or entity.
      Overrides:
      draw in class UI
      Parameters:
      g2 - the main graphics object that is used to draw the UI onto the screen

    • getPlayTime

      public int getPlayTime()
      Returns:
      the player's play time in seconds
